vlanVoice.name: vlanVoice

revisions.description: Editorial changes to support new MIB compilers.

vlanVoice.contactinfo: Postal: 170 West Tasman Drive San Jose , CA 95134-1706 USA Website: Cisco Small Business Support Community <http://www.cisco.com/go/smallbizsupport>
vlanVoice.description: The private MIB module definition for voice vlan support in switch devices.

vlanVoiceAdminVid.name: vlanVoiceAdminVid
vlanVoiceAdminVid.description: 1-4094 actual vlan (must exist in dot1qvlan static table)

vlanVoiceUcDeviceTable.name: vlanVoiceUcDeviceTable
vlanVoiceUcDeviceTable.description: A table containing static default and UC directly connected to device configuration.

vlanVoiceUcDeviceEntry.name: vlanVoiceUcDeviceEntry
vlanVoiceUcDeviceEntry.description: Static and dynamic per port information for a voice VLAN.

vlanVoiceUcDeviceInterface.name: vlanVoiceUcDeviceInterface
vlanVoiceUcDeviceInterface.description: Mac interface on which UC is connected

vlanVoiceUcDeviceIsBest.name: vlanVoiceUcDeviceIsBest
vlanVoiceUcDeviceIsBest.description: Indicates whether this entry is used as best local configuration

vlanVoiceAutoAdminVpt.name: vlanVoiceAutoAdminVpt
vlanVoiceAutoAdminVpt.description: user configured VPT for Voice Vlan operation

vlanVoiceAutoAdminDscp.name: vlanVoiceAutoAdminDscp
vlanVoiceAutoAdminDscp.description: user configured DSCP for Voice Vlan operation

vlanVoiceAutoOperVpt.name: vlanVoiceAutoOperVpt
vlanVoiceAutoOperVpt.description: operational VPT for Voice Vlan operation

vlanVoiceAutoOperDscp.name: vlanVoiceAutoOperDscp
vlanVoiceAutoOperDscp.description: user configured DSCP for Voice Vlan operation

vlanVoiceAutoOperSource.name: vlanVoiceAutoOperSource
vlanVoiceAutoOperSource.description: The Mac address of the switch by which we've selected the VVID

vlanVoiceAutoOperPriority.name: vlanVoiceAutoOperPriority
vlanVoiceAutoOperPriority.description: The reason for which Voice Vlan ID was selected.

vlanVoiceAutoRefresh.name: vlanVoiceAutoRefresh
vlanVoiceAutoRefresh.description: By setting the MIB to True, VSDP refresh will be executed.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedAdminPriority.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedAdminPriority
vlanVoiceOUIBasedAdminPriority.description: An administratively assigned Priority, which will be used for all traffic on the voice vlan, this gives the packets the requested priority (CoS) within the bridge.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedAdminRemark.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedAdminRemark
vlanVoiceOUIBasedAdminRemark.description: Remark VPT on tagged frames egress the voice vlan according. to priority true.false

vlanVoiceOUIBasedSetToDefault.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedSetToDefault
vlanVoiceOUIBasedSetToDefault.description: The vlanVoiceOUIBasedSetToDefault indicates that vlanVoiceOUIBasedTable should be set to it's default values if existed (OUI default prefixes). To do so the vlanVoiceOUIBasedTable should be previously deleted by usual entries destroying. This object behaviors as write-only than reading this object will always return 'false'.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedTable.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedTable
vlanVoiceOUIBasedTable.description: A table containing static global configuration information for Voice VLANs OUI MAC Prefixes. All entries are permanent and will be restored after the device is reset.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedEntry.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedEntry
vlanVoiceOUIBasedEntry.description: Information for a voice VLANs OUI MAC Prefixes configured into the device by management.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPrefix.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPrefix
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPrefix.description: The index value used to identify the OUI MAC Prefix component associated with this entry. The value of this object is used as an index to the vlanVoiceOUIBasedTable. Voice VLANs OUI Prefix is the first 3 most significant octets of the MAC address.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedDescription.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedDescription
vlanVoiceOUIBasedDescription.description: An optional text that describes the OUI.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedEntryRowStatus.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedEntryRowStatus
vlanVoiceOUIBasedEntryRowStatus.description: This object indicates the status of this entry.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortTable.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortTable
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortTable.description: A table containing static and dynamic per port configuration information for Voice VLAN. All entries are permanent and will be restored after the device is reset.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortEntry.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortEntry
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortEntry.description: Static and dynamic per port information for a voice VLAN.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortEnable.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortEnable
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortEnable.description: Enable this port to be a candidate to be added into the Voice VLAN.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortVlanIndex.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortVlanIndex
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortVlanIndex.description: The Voice VLAN-ID the port is a candidate to be in.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortSecure.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortSecure
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortSecure.description: Specify this port to be in Secure Mode when entering the Voice VLAN. In Secure mode only frames with MAC prefix matched to one of the OUI table prefixes are accepted, otherwise dropped.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortCurrentMembership.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortCurrentMembership
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortCurrentMembership.description: Port's current status of membership in Voice VLAN. Port's possible values of membership in Voice VLAN: 'Active(1)' - Port is currently added to a Voice VLAN . 'NotActive(2)' - Specifies either that port is a candidate to be in Voice VLAN or disabled.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortQosMode.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortQosMode
vlanVoiceOUIBasedPortQosMode.description: Port's current QOS mode in Voice VLAN. Possible values: 'src(1)' - Only traffic with OUI prefix in the source MAC received QOS of the Voice Vlan. 'all(2)' - All traffic through that port received QOS of the Voice Vlan.

vlanVoiceOUIBasedAgingTimeout.name: vlanVoiceOUIBasedAgingTimeout
vlanVoiceOUIBasedAgingTimeout.description: The vlanVoiceAgingTimeout indicates the time (in units of minutes) from when the last OUI MAC was ageout from the FDB the port will be removed from the Voice VLAN. The default value for vlanVoiceAgingTimeout object is 1440 minutes (24 hours). The value of this object must be restored from non-volatile storage after a re-initialization of the management system.
